Function for checking the amount of NaN values

pyiEEGfeatures.NaNControl.NaNControl(EEGdata, which_channel, srate, winLength, NaNthreshold, overlap)
Parameters

  • EEGdata (array) – matrix of EEG data, dimensions: channels x time points

  • srate (float) – sampling frequency in Hz

  • winLength (float) – the window length to split the data in seconds

  • NaNthreshold (float) – The lower cut-off as percentage of windows with NaNs values. This will be a threshold of denoting the EEGdata

  • example (eligible for computing the band power or just handling them as NaNs. For) –

  • 0.5 (this input parameter should be set as) –

  • if (this means that) –

  • 50% (the %windows with at least one NaN is greater than) –

  • replaced (then the band power values won't be computed and instead will be) –

  • values. (by NaNs) –

  • overlap (float) – the overlapping points expressed as proportion of the “winLength” parameter,

  • overlapping (for example for a 50%) –

  • 0.5 –

Returns

returns Fail or Pass. Fail mean that this part of segment exceeds the amount of NaNs according to the threshold specified.

Return type

boolean
